text: What is the Python equivalent of static variables inside a function?
What is the idiomatic Python equivalent of this C/C++ code?

code:
void foo()
{
    static int counter = 0;
    counter++;
    printf("counter is %d\n", counter);
}

text: specifically, how does one implement the static member at the function level, as opposed to the class level?
And does placing the function into a class change anything?
